caption:
The Beauty of Antinori. Designed by Archea Associati @archea_associati, the Antinori winery melds seamlessly into the rolling Tuscan hills. The sprawling facility incorporates a striking spiral staircase into its Cor-Ten steel façade and the roof is planted with vines. The building was finalist of European Union's 2015 architecture prize – the Mies van der Rohe Award @eumiesaward 

.
.
.
.

.
.
.
.
.

My series about »Muralla Roja« is running now on the Art Channel on Wallpaper* @wallpapermag. I am fascinated by the absurdly beautiful and surreal character of the building, designed by Ricardo Bofill.
.
.
Check out wallpaper.com/art
.
.
.
.
.
. 
#architizer #behance #archdaily #architecture_view #designboom #ignant #arkiminimal #dezeen #archaicmag #architecture_hunter

Image theft and copyright infringements have long since become an everyday annoyance for me as a photographer. On all continents and at all levels of education, mayors, theatre directors, architects, professors, students, art directors or gallery owners etc. use my pictures without authorization, proper credits, any payments and steal my work. Here is another inglorious example:
.
2 images from my awarded series „The Red Wall“ were used by one of the oldest Spanish newspaper »Las Provincias« @lasprovincias for an article about Bofill’s »La Muralla Roja«. @bofillarquitectura 
.
My photographs were used:
.
- without authorization by me as the photographer
- without credits and mention of me as the photographer
- without paying me as the photographer
.
The people at “Las Provincias” rejected my offer to subsequently purchase a usage license. The file names of the two images even contain my name! The photo editor @txemarodriguez is apparently too lazy to even cover up the fact that the images are being used illegally. The Wallpaper Magazine* paid to publish my images, why aren’t you paying?
.
.
What is wrong with the people? #copyrightinfringement by @lasprovincias
.
.
https://www.lasprovincias.es/marina-alta/bofill-calp-20230216100539-nt.html
.
.
.
.
.
.
.​​​​
.
.
.
.
.
.

Great memories to the architectural landmarks in Luxembourg. For example the great water tower in Leudelange, which is so wonderful to play with! The concrete beauty was designed by Luxembourg based studio »Schemel Wirtz Architectes Associés«. @schemelwirtzarchitectes

Hamburg horizon. The building is called »Mundsburg« and is one of the tallest houses in Germany. The ensemble consists of three residential and commercial buildings that are up to 100 meters high and were designed in the mid-1970s by the German architects »Garten, Kahl and Bargholz«.

Two years ago today, on January 14, 2022, the genius of postmodernism, the Spanish architect Ricardo Bofill, died.

In memory of Bofill, I would like to celebrate and honor his great work with three triptychs. @bofillarquitectura 

The last series with photographs of „La Fabrica“ in Sant Just Desvern, Spain. The home and studio of the Bofill familly and Ricardo Bofill Taller d’Arquitectura. The former cement factory enchants with its sculptural character.

.
.

Two years ago today, on January 14, 2022, the genius of postmodernism, the Spanish architect Ricardo Bofill, died.

In memory of Bofill, I would like to celebrate and honor his great work with three triptychs. @bofillarquitectura 

Let’s continue with „Walden 7“, an apartment building located in Sant Just Desvern near Barcelona, Spain. It was built in 1975. The whole building is an impressive feast for the eyes!
